Classical.Structure: Star-shaped glial cell in the central nervous system.
Classical.Function: Maintains brain homeostasis, provides nutrients to neurons, modulates synaptic transmission, forms the blood-brain barrier.
Classical.Pathology: Astrogliosis (scarring), neurotoxicity (e.g., Alexander disease), role in neuroinflammation.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A core component of the 'Slow Control Network'. The astrocyte syncytium forms a macroscopic coherent network via gap junctions (connexin-43), which have a high quantum tunnelling amplitude. This network supports coherent calcium waves.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'ground' or 'medium' of consciousness. Manages the coherence milieu and engineers the 'decoherence shield' for the neurons.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Blocking connexin-43 gap junctions will fail to disrupt long-range quantum coherence signatures (e.g., entanglement witnesses) across the astrocyte network.
Calcium wave propagation will be fully described by classical diffusion, showing no quantum coherence (e.g., non-local correlation) signatures.
Experimental_Protocols: [cite_start]Measure quantum entanglement entropy (S_entanglement) across an astrocyte syncytium in vitro. [cite: 1815-1819]
Model calcium waves as a coherent quantum phenomenon and test for non-classical propagation.

KeyEquations_LaTeX: Astrocyte Hamiltonian: H_{astro} = H_{gap} + H_{Ca_wave} + H_{sync}
Gap Junction Tunnelling: H_{gap} = -t_{cx} \sum_{\langle ij \rangle} (\sigma_i^+ \sigma_j^- + h.c.) \text{ (where } t_{cx} \approx 0.08 \text{ eV)}
